title: Post-install issue: Anaconda3, Ubuntu 16.04 Python 3.6 Caffe2
body_html:
PyTorch GitHub Issues Guidelines

We like to limit our issues to bug reports and feature requests. If you have a question or would like help and support, please visit our forums: https://discuss.pytorch.org/

If you are submitting a feature request, please preface the title with [feature request].

When submitting a bug report, please include the following information (where relevant):
PyTorch or Caffe2: Caffe2
OS:Ubuntu 16.04
PyTorch version:
How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): PyTorch not installed in this environment at this time
Python version:3.6
CUDA/cuDNN version:9.0/7.0
GPU models and configuration: GeForce 1050Ti
GCC version (if compiling from source):5.4
CMake version:3.9.0-rc5
Build command you used (if compiling from source):
Versions of any other relevant libraries:
Native Python in Ubuntu 16.04 is Python2 (2.7) and Python3 (3.5)

Anaconda3 installed (Version4.5.0)
Created an environment conda create --name caffe36 python==3.6
source activate caffe36
conda install -c caffe2 caffe2-cuda9.0-cudnn7
python -c 'from caffe2.python import core' 2>/dev/null && echo "Success" || echo "Failure" results in success
python -c 'from caffe2.python import workspace' 2>/dev/null && echo "Success" || echo "Failure" results in success

Thanks to @pjh5 for guding me through this 💯

Now comes the post-install issue

Am following a tutorial from https://github.com/caffe2/tutorials
A notebook called Basics.ipynb or CIFAR10_Part1.ipynb

After running the very first cell... I see messages

WARNING:root:This caffe2 python run does not have GPU support. Will run in CPU only mode.
WARNING:root:Debug message: libnccl.so.2: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

Caffe2 install was with conda install -c caffe2 caffe2-cuda9.0-cudnn7

other packages keras, tensorflow successfully run on GPU, why does caffe2 fail?

My updates
This looks like a repeat of #2264
I have installed NCCL 2.1.15 after reading #2264. The warning This caffe2 python run does not have GPU support remains

body:
PyTorch GitHub Issues Guidelines
--------------------------------

We like to limit our issues to bug reports and feature requests. If you have a question or would like help and support, please visit our forums: https://discuss.pytorch.org/

If you are submitting a feature request, please preface the title with [feature request].

When submitting a bug report, please include the following information (where relevant):
PyTorch or Caffe2: **Caffe2**
OS:**Ubuntu 16.04**
PyTorch version:
How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): **PyTorch not installed in this environment at this time**
Python version:**3.6**
CUDA/cuDNN version:**9.0/7.0**
GPU models and configuration: **GeForce 1050Ti**
GCC version (if compiling from source):**5.4**
CMake version:**3.9.0-rc5**
Build command you used (if compiling from source):
Versions of any other relevant libraries:
Native Python in Ubuntu 16.04 is Python2 (2.7) and Python3 (3.5)

Anaconda3 installed (Version4.5.0)
Created an environment conda create --name caffe36 python==3.6
source activate caffe36
conda install -c caffe2 caffe2-cuda9.0-cudnn7
python -c 'from caffe2.python import core' 2>/dev/null && echo "Success" || echo "Failure" results in **success**
python -c 'from caffe2.python import workspace' 2>/dev/null && echo "Success" || echo "Failure" results in **success**

Thanks to @pjh5 for guding me [through](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/6464) this :100: 

Now comes the post-install issue

Am following a tutorial from [https://github.com/caffe2/tutorials](https://github.com/caffe2/tutorials
)
A notebook called **Basics.ipynb** or **CIFAR10_Part1.ipynb**

After running the very first cell... I see messages

WARNING:root:This caffe2 python run **does not** have GPU support. Will run in CPU only mode.
WARNING:root:Debug message: libnccl.so.2: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

Caffe2 install was with conda install -c caffe2 caffe2-cuda9.0-cudnn7

other packages keras, tensorflow successfully run on GPU, why does caffe2 fail?

**My updates**
This looks like a repeat of #2264
I have installed NCCL 2.1.15 after reading #2264. The warning This caffe2 python run **does not** have GPU support remains
